Justin Kropp

I'm a user experience designer based out of Chattanooga, TN. My expertise and interests sit at the intersection of digital product design, design systems, and product strategy.

I send out an occasional newsletter that supplements the writing here and covers a more eclectic mix of observations and thoughts.

2019 Notable Reads

04 Jan 2020

This past year I made a concerted effort to read more. I wanted what I read to span a range of topics that I’m currently interested in as well as those that I’m not well versed but would like to be.

I oddly don’t read much fiction, but that’s something I’d like to change for 2020. For 2019 I ended up finishing a book every couple weeks and I’m hoping to double that number for 2020. Below are a few standouts for 2019 that I particularly enjoyed.

  1. The Four Horsemen by Christopher Hitchens
  2. Letter to a Young Contrarian by Christopher Hitchens
  3. Islam and the Future of Tolerance: A Dialogue by Sam Harris
  4. The Burden of Bad Ideas by Heather Mac Donald
  5. 12 Rules for Life by Jordan B. Peterson
  6. Black Rednecks and White Liberals by Thomas Sowell
  7. Discrimination and Disparities by Thomas Sowell
  8. Economic Facts and Fallacies by Thomas Sowell
  9. The Madness of Crowds by Douglas Murray
  10. Principles by Ray Dalio
  11. Now You See It by Michael Bierut
  12. Writing Tools by Roy Peter Clark
  13. Coming Apart by Charles Murray
